title: Ex-student charged over hacking university for cheap parking, data breaches
summary: New South Wales police in Australia have arrested a 27-year-old former Western Sydney University (WSU) student for allegedly hacking into the University's systems on multiple occasions, starting with a scheme to obtain cheaper parking. [...]

title: Cisco warns of max severity RCE flaws in Identity Services Engine
summary: Cisco has published a bulletin to warn about two critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities affecting Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) and the Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC). [...]

title: Man pleads guilty to hacking networks to pitch security services
summary: A Kansas City man has pleaded guilty to hacking multiple organizations to advertise his cybersecurity services, the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Wednesday. [...]

title: 3 key takeaways from the Scattered Spider attacks on insurance firms
summary: Scattered Spider recently pivoted from targeting worldwide retailers to U.S. based insurance firms, with no signs of slowing down. Learn about Scattered Spider TTPs and how to defend your organization against MFA bypass, help desk scams, and more. [...]

title: Critical RCE Flaws in Cisco ISE and ISE-PIC Allow Unauthenticated Attackers to Gain Root Access
summary:
Cisco has released updates to address two maximum-severity security flaws in Identity Services Engine (ISE) and ISE Passive Identity Connector (ISE-PIC) that could permit an unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands as the root user.

title: New FileFix Method Emerges as a Threat Following 517% Rise in ClickFix Attacks
summary:
The ClickFix social engineering tactic as an initial access vector using fake CAPTCHA verifications increased by 517% between the second half of 2024 and the first half of this year, according to data from ESET.

title: Microsoft 365 'Direct Send' abused to send phishing as internal users
summary: An ongoing phishing campaign abuses a little‑known feature in Microsoft 365 called "Direct Send" to evade detection by email security and steal credentials. [...]

summary:

title: Microsoft fixes Outlook bug causing crashes when opening emails
summary: Microsoft has fixed a known issue that will cause the classic Outlook email client to crash when opening emails or starting a new message. [...]

title: Microsoft confirms Family Safety blocks Google Chrome from launching
summary: Microsoft has confirmed that its Family Safety parental control service is blocking users from launching Google Chrome and other web browsers on Windows systems. [...]

title: Iranian APT35 Hackers Targeting Israeli Tech Experts with AI-Powered Phishing Attacks
summary:
An Iranian state-sponsored hacking group associated with the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) has been linked to a spear-phishing campaign targeting journalists, high-profile cyber security experts, and computer science professors in Israel.

title: CISA: AMI MegaRAC bug enabling server hijacks exploited in attacks
summary: CISA says a maximum severity vulnerability in AMI's MegaRAC Baseboard Management Controller (BMC) software, which enables attackers to hijack and brick servers, is currently under active exploitation. [...]

title: Cyber Criminals Exploit Open-Source Tools to Compromise Financial Institutions Across Africa
summary:
Cybersecurity researchers are calling attention to a series of cyber attacks targeting financial organizations across Africa since at least July 2023 using a mix of open-source and publicly available tools to maintain access.

title: CISA Adds 3 Flaws to KEV Catalog, Impacting AMI MegaRAC, D-Link, Fortinet
summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Wednesday added three security flaws, each impacting AMI MegaRAC, D-Link DIR-859 router, and Fortinet FortiOS, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, based on evidence of active exploitation.
